summary.content:
Today's selection covers 95 articles from 8 trusted sources, including 63 on Artificial Intelligence and 21 on Fraud/Cybersecurity.

• **AI Spotlight**: Defense Department and Anthropic Square Off in Dispute Over A.I. Safety
• **Companies in Focus**: Coverage includes developments from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic
• **Security Alert**: CISA: Hackers Exploiting Vulnerability in Product of Taiwan Security Firm TeamT5
• **Threat Landscape**: Today's coverage highlights ransomware, phishing, data breaches
• **Source Diversity**: Articles sourced from NY Times Tech, TechCrunch, Dark Reading, The Verge, SecurityWeek and others
• **Fresh Content**: 46 articles published in the last 24 hours

top.title: Defense Department and Anthropic Square Off in Dispute Over A.I. Safety
top.description: How artificial intelligence will be used in future battlefields is an issue that has turned increasingly political and may put Anthropic in a bind.

top.title: Meta Begins $65 Million Election Push to Advance A.I. Agenda
top.description: Meta’s biggest election investment aims to prevent state legislation that it fears could inhibit artificial intelligence development. Its spending starts this week in Texas and Illinois.

top.title: OpenAI taps Tata for 100MW AI data center capacity in India, eyes 1GW
top.description: OpenAI also plans to expand its presence in India with new offices in Mumbai and Bengaluru later this year.

top.title: OpenAI deepens India push with Pine Labs fintech partnership
top.description: OpenAI moves beyond ChatGPT in India with a Pine Labs deal targeting enterprise payments and AI-driven commerce.

top.title: Scam Abuses Gemini Chatbots to Convince People to Buy Fake Crypto
top.description: A convincing presale site for phony "Google Coin" features an AI assistant that engages victims with a slick sales pitch, funneling payment to attackers.

top.title: Google’s AI music maker is coming to the Gemini app
top.description:
Let Gemini be your, uh, Bard? | Image: Google	

Google has given Gemini the ability to spit out AI-generated music, courtesy of DeepMind's latest audio model. Beta access to Lyria 3 is rolling out in...

more.title: Perplexity joins anti-ad camp as AI companies battle over trust and revenue
more.description: AI search startup Perplexity is distancing itself from ads amid fears users won't trust chatbots with an agenda to upsell. The move highlights an emerging crossroads for the AI industry as the sector'...

more.title: OpenAI pushes into higher education as India seeks to scale AI skills
more.description: OpenAI says its India education partnerships aim to reach more than 100,000 students, faculty, and staff over the next year.

more.title: Is your startup’s check engine light on? Google Cloud’s VP explains what to do
more.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to...

more.title: Google Cloud’s VP for startups on reading your ‘check engine light’ before it’s too late
more.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to...

more.title: CISA: Hackers Exploiting Vulnerability in Product of Taiwan Security Firm TeamT5
more.description:
The vulnerability added to CISA’s KEV catalog affects ThreatSonar Anti-Ransomware and it was patched in 2024.
The post CISA: Hackers Exploiting Vulnerability in Product of Taiwan Security Firm TeamT5...

more.title: Could Bill Gates and political tussles overshadow AI safety debate in Delhi?
more.description: As global tech leaders meet Delhi, India hopes to level the playing field for countries outside the US and China.

more.title: Dell's Hard-Coded Flaw: A Nation-State Goldmine
more.description: A China-related attacker has exploited the vendor flaw since mid-2024, allowing it to move laterally, maintain persistent access, and deploy malware.

more.title: Supply Chain Attack Embeds Malware in Android Devices
more.description: Keenadu downloads payloads that hijack browser searches, commit ad fraud, and execute other actions without user knowledge.

more.title: Bill Gates pulls out of India's AI summit amid Epstein files controversy
more.description: The Gates Foundation said the decision was made to "ensure the focus remains on the summit's key priorities".

more.title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial
more.description: The billionaire boss said he "always" regretted not making faster progress to identify users under 13.

more.title: Meta’s new deal with Nvidia buys up millions of AI chips
more.description: Meta has struck a multiyear deal to expand its data centers with millions of Nvidia's Grace and Vera CPUs and Blackwell and Rubin GPUs. While Meta has long been using Nvidia's hardware for its AI prod...

more.title: Google’s AI search results will make links more obvious
more.description: Google says it will now display links more prominently inside its AI-powered features in Search. Robby Stein, the vice president of Google Search, announced on Tuesday that a list of links will now ap...

more.title: Google announces dates for I/O 2026
more.description: It's official: Google I/O 2026 will take place from May 19th to 20th. In an announcement on Tuesday, Google says it will share the "latest AI breakthroughs and updates in products across the company,...

more.title: Samsung is slopping AI ads all over its social channels
more.description:
Even if the AI wasn’t being disclosed, its usage in these videos isn’t exactly subtle. | Image: Samsung / The Verge	

After cramming AI into every inch of its smartphones, appliances, and other device...

more.title: Telegram channels expose rapid weaponization of SmarterMail flaws
more.description: Underground Telegram channels shared SmarterMail exploit PoCs and stolen admin credentials within days of disclosure. Flare explains how monitoring these communities reveals rapid weaponization of CVE...

more.title: Decoding the A.I. Beliefs of Anthropic and Its C.E.O., Dario Amodei
more.description: The company is at odds with the Pentagon over how its A.I. will be used. The conflict has its roots in the foundational plan for Anthropic.

more.title: Mark Zuckerberg Takes the Stand in Social Media Addiction Trial
more.description: Meta’s chief executive said users spent a lot of time on Instagram because of its value, as he was grilled about child safety issues in front of a jury.

more.title: Vulnerabilities in Popular PDF Platforms Allowed Account Takeover, Data Exfiltration
more.description:
Novee researchers discovered 16 vulnerabilities in Foxit and Apryse PDF tools that could have been exploited via malicious documents or URLs.
The post Vulnerabilities in Popular PDF Platforms Allowed...

more.title: More Than 40% of South Africans Were Scammed in 2025
more.description: Survey underscores the reality that scammers follow "scalable opportunities and low friction," rather than rich targets that tend to be better protected.

more.title: Call of Duty advert banned for trivialising sexual violence
more.description: Activision Blizzard UK Ltd said the ad for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 was targeted at adults.

more.title: Elon Musk’s xAI Gets $3 Billion Investment From Saudi-Backed A.I. Firm
more.description: Humain, which was created by Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman last year, said it made the investment just before xAI was acquired by SpaceX, Mr. Musk’s rocket company.

more.title: Uber Taking Steps to Expand Number of EV Chargers Near Its Drivers
more.description: The company said it would encourage companies that operated chargers to install them in neighborhoods where its drivers lived and work.

more.title: Running AI models is turning into a memory game
more.description: When we talk about the cost of AI infrastructure, the focus is usually on Nvidia and GPUs -- but memory is an increasingly important part of the picture.

more.title: Critical Grandstream VoIP Bug Highlights SMB Security Blind Spot
more.description: CVE-2026-2329 allows unauthenticated root-level access to SMB phone infrastructure, so attackers can intercept calls, commit toll fraud, and impersonate users.

more.title: AI platforms can be abused for stealthy malware communication
more.description: AI assistants like Grok and Microsoft Copilot with web browsing and URL-fetching capabilities can be abused to intermediate command-and-control (C2) activity. [...]

more.title: A CISO's Playbook for Defending Data Assets Against AI Scraping
more.description: Discover a strategic approach to govern scraping risks, balance security with business growth, and safeguard intellectual capital from automated data harvesting.

more.title: Microsoft: Anti-phishing rules mistakenly blocked emails, Teams messages
more.description: Microsoft says an Exchange Online issue that mistakenly quarantined legitimate emails last week was triggered by faulty heuristic detection rules designed to block credential phishing campaigns. [...]

more.title: Data breach at fintech firm Figure affects nearly 1 million accounts
more.description: Hackers have stolen the personal and contact information of nearly 1 million accounts after breaching the systems of Figure Technology Solutions, a self-described blockchain-native financial technolog...

more.title: Microsoft says bug causes Copilot to summarize confidential emails
more.description: Microsoft says a Microsoft 365 Copilot bug has been causing the AI assistant to summarize confidential emails since late January, bypassing data loss prevention (DLP) policies that organizations rely...

more.title: Glendale man gets 5 years in prison for role in darknet drug ring
more.description: ​A Glendale man was sentenced to nearly five years in federal prison for his role in a darknet drug trafficking operation that sold cocaine, methamphetamine, MDMA, and ketamine to customers across the...

more.title: Amazon halts Blue Jay robotics project after less than 6 months
more.description: Amazon said Blue Jay's core tech will be used for other robotics projects and the employees who worked on it were moved to other projects.

more.title: World Labs lands $1B, with $200M from Autodesk, to bring world models into 3D workflows
more.description: The partnership will see the two companies exploring how World Labs’ models can work alongside Autodesk’s tools, and vice versa, starting with a focus on entertainment use cases.

more.title: Google adds music-generation capabilities to the Gemini app
more.description: Users will be able to use text, images, and videos as a reference to generate music.

more.title: Kana emerges from stealth with $15M to build flexible AI agents for marketers
more.description: Kana, a new AI marketing startup from the founders of Rapt and Krux, has raised $15 million to build customizable, agent-based marketing tools.

more.title: Microsoft says Office bug exposed customers’ confidential emails to Copilot AI
more.description: Microsoft said the bug meant that its Copilot AI chatbot was reading and summarizing paying customers' confidential emails, bypassing data-protection policies.

more.title: India’s Sarvam wants to bring its AI models to feature phones, cars, and smart glasses
more.description: The company is using edge models that take up only megabytes of space, can run on most phones with existing processors, and can work offline.

more.title: Indian AI lab Sarvam’s new models are a major bet on the viability of open source AI
more.description: The new lineup includes 30-billion- and 105-billion-parameter models; a text-to-speech model; a speech-to-text model; and a vision model to parse documents.

more.title: New Keenadu Android Malware Found on Thousands of Devices
more.description:
The malware has been preinstalled on many devices but it has also been distributed through Google Play and other app stores.
The post New Keenadu Android Malware Found on Thousands of Devices appeared...

more.title: Cogent Security Raises $42 Million for AI-Driven Vulnerability Management
more.description:
The Series A funding round, led by Bain Capital, brings the total raised by Cogent to $53 million.
The post Cogent Security Raises $42 Million for AI-Driven Vulnerability Management appeared first on...

more.title: Critical infra Honeywell CCTVs vulnerable to auth bypass flaw
more.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning of a critical vulnerability in multiple Honeywell CCTV products that allows unauthorized access to feeds or account hijackin...

more.title: Laurie Spiegel on the difference between algorithmic music and ‘AI’
more.description:
From Bell Labs to Macs, Laurie Spiegel has pushed musical boundaries. | Image: Irina Prosser / Eventide	

In 1986, electronic music pioneer Laurie Spiegel created Music Mouse, a way for those with a M...

more.title: Chinese hackers exploiting Dell zero-day flaw since mid-2024
more.description: A suspected Chinese state-backed hacking group has been quietly exploiting a critical Dell security flaw in zero-day attacks that started in mid-2024. [...]

more.title: [Virtual Event] Shields Up: Key Technologies Reshaping Cybersecurity Defenses
Tech Life
more.description: We chat about a conversational AI that's almost human-like in its speech skills.

more.title: With Niche Tech World References, Vibe Hopes Its Billboards Reach Start-Up Insiders
more.description: Billboards that wouldn’t make sense to people outside the tech industry have become common in the Bay Area. One company took the microtargeting game to another level.

more.title: Poland Energy Survives Attack on Wind, Solar Infrastructure
more.description: Russia-aligned groups are probable culprits behind the wiper attacks against renewable energy farms, a manufacturer, and a heating and power plant.

more.title: RMM Abuse Explodes as Hackers Ditch Malware
more.description: Remote monitoring and management (RMM) software offers hackers multiple benefits, including stealth, persistence, and operational efficiency.

more.title: ClickFix Attacks Abuses DNS Lookup Command to Deliver ModeloRAT
more.description: ClickFix campaigns have adapted to the latest defenses with a new technique to trick users into infecting their own machines with malware.

more.title: Apple is reportedly planning to launch AI-powered glasses, a pendant, and AirPods
more.description:
The second-gen Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses. | Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge	

Apple is pushing ahead with plans to launch its first pair of smart glasses, along with an AI-powered pendant...

more.title: WordPress’ new AI assistant will let users edit their sites with prompts
more.description: Starting on Tuesday, WordPress users can edit their websites using the new AI assistant built into the platform's site editor and media library, TechCrunch reports. The AI has a sidebar in the WordPre...

more.title: Let’s talk about Ring, lost dogs, and the surveillance state
more.description:
Today, let’s talk about the camera company Ring, lost dogs, and the surveillance state. 
You probably saw this ad during the Super Bowl a couple of weekends ago:

Since it aired for a massive audience...

more.title: Spain orders NordVPN, ProtonVPN to block LaLiga piracy sites
more.description: A Spanish court has granted precautionary measures against NordVPN and ProtonVPN, ordering the two popular VPN providers to block 16 websites that facilitate piracy of football matches. [...]

more.title: Notepad++ boosts update security with ‘double-lock’ mechanism
more.description: Notepad++ has adopted a "double-lock" design for its update mechanism to address recently exploited security gaps that resulted in a supply-chain compromise. [...]

more.title: New Keenadu backdoor found in Android firmware, Google Play apps
more.description: A newly discovered and sophisticated Android malware called Keenadu has been found embedded in firmware from multiple device brands, enabling it to compromise all installed applications and gain unres...

more.title: Poland arrests suspect linked to Phobos ransomware operation
more.description: Polish police have detained a 47-year-old man suspected of ties to the Phobos ransomware group and seized computers and mobile phones containing stolen credentials, credit card numbers, and server acc...

more.title: Apple is reportedly cooking up a trio of AI wearables
more.description: As the AI hardware space heats up, the iPhone maker has multiple smart products in development.

more.title: Anthropic releases Sonnet 4.6
more.description: Anthropic has released a new version of its midsized Sonnet model, keeping pace with the company's four-month update cycle.

more.title: Mistral AI buys Koyeb in first acquisition to back its cloud ambitions
more.description: Mistral AI has agreed to buy Koyeb, a Paris-based startup that simplifies AI app deployment at scale and manages the infrastructure behind it.

more.title: SpaceX vets raise $50M Series A for data center links
more.description: Mesh aims to mass-produce optical transceivers for AI data centers.

more.title: European Parliament blocks AI on lawmakers’ devices, citing security risks
more.description: EU lawmakers found their government-issued devices were blocked from using the baked-in AI tools, amid fears that sensitive information could turn up on the U.S. servers of AI companies.

more.title: WordPress.com adds an AI Assistant that can edit, adjust styles, create images, and more
more.description: The feature is designed to work inside the website to understand its content and layout, allowing site owners to make changes with natural language commands. The WordPress AI assistant doesn't need pr...

more.title: Dell RecoverPoint Zero-Day Exploited by Chinese Cyberespionage Group
more.description:
GTIG and Mandiant said the zero-day tracked as CVE-2026-22769 has been exploited by UNC6201 since at least 2024.
The post Dell RecoverPoint Zero-Day Exploited by Chinese Cyberespionage Group appeared...

more.title: VulnCheck Raises $25 Million in Series B Funding to Scale Vulnerability Intelligence
more.description:
The latest funding round was led by Sorenson Capital and brings the total investment to $45 million.
The post VulnCheck Raises $25 Million in Series B Funding to Scale Vulnerability Intelligence appea...

more.title: Hackers Offer to Sell Millions of Eurail User Records
more.description:
Eurail has confirmed that the stolen data is up for sale, but it’s still trying to determine how many individuals are impacted.
The post Hackers Offer to Sell Millions of Eurail User Records appeared...

more.title: API Threats Grow in Scale as AI Expands the Blast Radius
more.description:
New research shows attackers increasingly abusing APIs at machine speed as AI-driven systems widen exposure and amplify impact.
The post API Threats Grow in Scale as AI Expands the Blast Radius appear...

more.title: Cyber Insights 2026: The Ongoing Fight to Secure Industrial Control Systems
more.description: As nation-state actors, ransomware groups, and aging infrastructure collide, organizations must rethink how they defend critical operations through resilience, visibility, and modern security strategi...

more.title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
more.description: The government is proposing that intimate image abuse should be treated more severely.

more.title: Etsy sells second-hand fashion app Depop to eBay for $1.2bn
more.description: The "pre-loved" fashion firm has been sold by Etsy just five years after it bought the firm.

more.title: V&A displays first YouTube video and watchpage
more.description: The original YouTube experience from 2005 has been recreated using internet archives.

more.title: How to Watch Free Live Television on Your Phone or Tablet
more.description: Whether by app or old-school antennas, budget-friendly options abound.

more.title: What Do A.I. Chatbots Discuss Among Themselves? We Sent One to Find Out.
more.description: We interviewed our bot about what it learned on Moltbook, the A.I.-only social network.

more.title: Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Koi in Reported $400 Million Transaction
more.description:
Koi has developed an endpoint security solution that Palo Alto will use to enhance its products.
The post Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Koi in Reported $400 Million Transaction appeared first on Secur...

more.title: ByteDance to curb AI video app after Disney legal threat
more.description: Videos featuring Spider-Man and other characters which are Disney's intellectual property have gone viral since Seedance's update.

more.title: Reddit's human content wins amid the AI flood
more.description: Reddit says its human contributors are valued amid an internet awash with AI-generated content.

more.title: User Issues With X Appear to Have Resolved
more.description: The social media site was the subject of user complaints early Monday.

more.title: Flaws in popular VSCode extensions expose developers to attacks
more.description: Vulnerabilities with high to critical severity ratings affecting popular Visual Studio Code (VSCode) extensions collectively downloaded more than 128 million times could be exploited to steal local fi...

more.title: Operation DoppelBrand: Weaponizing Fortune 500 Brands
more.description: The GS7 cyber-threat group targets US financial institutions with near-perfect imitations of corporate portals to steal credentials and gain remote access.

more.title: 260K+ Chrome Users Duped by Fake AI Browser Extensions
more.description: 30 copycat apps tricked users, and Google itself, into thinking they're legitimate AI tools.

more.title: 'I do not trust them' - top streamers left concerned by Discord age checks
more.description: The platform's plan to roll out global age checks has caused concern in streaming communities.

more.title: Chatbots Are the New Influencers Brands Must Woo
more.description: Companies are realizing they can no longer simply promote themselves to potential customers. They have to win over the robots, too.

more.title: Password managers' promise that they can't see your vaults isn't always true
more.description: Contrary to what password managers say, a server compromise can mean game over.

more.title: Most VMware users still "actively reducing their VMware footprint," survey finds
more.description: Broadcom's "strategy was never to keep every customer," CloudBolt report says.

more.title: Singapore & Its 4 Major Telcos Fend Off Chinese Hackers
more.description: After detecting a zero-day attack, the country's effective response was attributed to the tight relationship between its government and private industry.

more.title: Microsoft Teams outage affects users in United States, Europe
more.description: ​Microsoft is working to resolve an ongoing outage affecting Microsoft Teams users, causing delays and preventing some from accessing the service. [...]

more.title: What 5 Million Apps Revealed About Secrets in JavaScript
more.description: Leaked API keys are nothing new, but the scale of the problem in front-end code has been largely a mystery - until now. Intruder's research team built a new secrets detection method and scanned 5 mill...

more.title: Amazon Fire TV’s new interface is now rolling out in the US
more.description: Fire TV's new interface simplifies its layout and navigation and adds Alexa+.

more.title: How dark web agent spotted bedroom wall clue to rescue girl from years of harm
more.description: Detectives desperate to locate a 12-year-old, seen abused online, found a surprising lead.

more.title: New Silent Hill game inspired by tiny fishing village in Fife
more.description: Silent Hill: Townfall is set in the fictional St Amelia, based on the real village of St Monans in the East Neuk of Fife.

more.title: Their Secret to a Happy Marriage? A Translation App
more.description: He speaks English. She speaks Mandarin. The secret to their happy marriage: Microsoft Translator.
